excerpt: Modern museum tracing the history of the Himalayan range with mountaineering & nature exhibits.
detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque city of Pokhara, the International Mountain Museum is a treasure trove for mountain enthusiasts and nature lovers alike. This modern museum beautifully chronicles the rich history of the majestic Himalayan range through captivating mountaineering exhibits and immersive displays. Visitors can explore a Living Museum that highlights the vibrant cultures of various indigenous tribes from Nepal, offering an authentic glimpse into their traditions.
name: International Mountain Museum

excerpt: Pagoda-style Buddhist monument to peace, offering stunning mountain & lake views.
detail_description: Nestled atop Ananda Hill, the World Peace Pagoda, also known as Shanti Stupa, is a breathtaking Buddhist monument that stands 35 meters tall and radiates tranquility. Constructed in the 1970s by Japanese monks, this stunning white structure offers panoramic views of Pokhara, Phewa Lake, and the majestic Annapurna mountain range.
name: World Peace Pagoda , Pokhara
address: 6W2V+4JQ, World Peace Stupa Access Rd, Pokhara 33700, Nepal

excerpt: Sarangkot is Ward 18 of Pokhara, Kaski District, Nepal, after it was merged into the city in 2015. It is a popular tourist destination for those who arrive in Pokhara. At the 1991 Nepal census it had a total population of 5,060 with 1,010 individual households. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Nestled in Ward 18 of Pokhara, Kaski District, Sarangkot is a must-visit destination for travelers exploring Nepal. This charming locale became part of the city in 2015 and has since captivated visitors with its stunning views and vibrant atmosphere. The area boasts a delightful climate and offers an array of activities, from paragliding adventures to serene moments at the World Peace Pagoda overlooking Fewa Tal (Lake).
name: Sarangkot

excerpt: Large freshwater lake offers scenic mountain views, nature trails & an iconic Hindu temple.
detail_description: Phewa Lake is a stunning freshwater gem nestled in the heart of Pokhara, surrounded by majestic mountains and lush nature trails. As you embark on an evening boat ride, you'll be enveloped by a refreshing breeze and the serene ambiance of calm waters. The breathtaking reflection of Mount Machapuchhre creates an almost surreal atmosphere that feels like art crafted by divine hands.
name: Phewa Lake

excerpt: Time-tested cave formations with ample natural lighting & an underground waterfall.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Pokhara, Gupteshwor Mahadev Cave is a mesmerizing natural wonder that showcases the beauty of time-honored cave formations. This enchanting cavern has been sculpted over centuries by flowing water, creating stunning rock structures illuminated by ample natural light. As you explore this underground marvel, you'll also encounter an impressive waterfall cascading within its depths, adding to the cave's allure.
name: Gupteshwor Mahadev Cave

excerpt: Museum with interactive multimedia exhibits dedicated to the history of Nepal's Gurkha soldiers.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Pokhara, the Gurkha Memorial Museum is a captivating tribute to the legendary Gurkha soldiers of Nepal. This museum offers an immersive experience through its interactive multimedia exhibits that chronicle the rich history and valor of these elite warriors. From their involvement in significant historical events like the 19th-century Indian uprising and both World Wars to their ongoing contributions in peacekeeping missions worldwide, every corner of this museum tells a story.
name: Gurkha Memorial Museum

excerpt: Self-guided tours through a small limestone cave with stalactites & stalagmites.
detail_description: Nestled in Pokhara, Mahendra Cave is a must-visit spot offering self-guided tours through a small limestone cave adorned with stalactites and stalagmites. The highlight of the cave is a statue of Lord Shiva, drawing numerous visitors annually. Just a short walk away lies the intriguing Bat Cave, home to thousands of horseshoe bats clinging to the ceiling. Exiting this unique cave involves squeezing and bending through a narrow door, adding an unforgettable twist to the experience.
name: Mahendra Cave

excerpt: Monumental Hindu temple complex with gardens & views of the Himalayas at the top of the site.
detail_description: Nestled atop a small hill, the Shree Bindhyabasini Temple is a monumental Hindu temple complex that offers breathtaking views of the majestic Himalayas. This ancient site, dedicated to Goddess Bhagawati, stands at an elevation of 3000 feet above sea level and is one of the oldest temples in the Pokhara Valley. Surrounded by lush gardens and natural beauty, it attracts both Hindus and Buddhists alike who come to pay their respects.
name: Shree Bindhyabasini Temple

detail_description: When visiting Pokhara, make sure to explore the Tibetan Refugee Camp, a serene area adorned with colorful prayer flags that add to its charm. Home to numerous monks, the camp resonates with the sound of their prayers. Situated just 3 km from the city center, this small world within Pokhara was established for Tibetan refugees who sought shelter in Nepal following the Chinese takeover.
name: Tibetan Refugee Camp

excerpt: Compact pagoda temple situated on a tiny island in the middle of a lake with mountain views.
detail_description: Nestled on a small island in the serene Fewa Lake, Tal Barahi Temple is a stunning pagoda-style shrine that offers breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains. As part of a full-day sightseeing tour in Pokhara, visitors can explore this iconic temple along with other attractions like David's Fall and Gupteshwor Cave. The picturesque lake reflects the majestic Annapurna range, creating an enchanting backdrop for photography enthusiasts.
name: Tal Barahi Temple, Pokhara

detail_description: Old Pokhara Bazaar, situated about 4 km north of Lakeside, offers a glimpse into the historical past of the city. The area features traditional Newar architecture with red brick houses and served as the primary trading hub between Tibet and Kathmandu 300 years ago. Amidst modernization, this part of the city retains its authentic charm.
name: Old Pokhara Bazaar

excerpt: Pokhara is a city on Phewa Lake, in central Nepal. It’s known as a gateway to the Annapurna Circuit, a popular trail in the Himalayas. Tal Barahi Temple, a 2-story pagoda, sits on an island in the lake. On the eastern shore, the Lakeside district has yoga centers and restaurants. In the city’s south, the International Mountain Museum has exhibits on the history of mountaineering and the people of the Himalayas.
detail_description: Pokhara, a city in central Nepal, is renowned as the gateway to the Annapurna Circuit, a famous Himalayan trail. The city boasts the picturesque Phewa Lake with the Tal Barahi Temple on an island and the Lakeside district offering yoga centers and dining options. Additionally, visitors can explore the International Mountain Museum in Pokhara's south for insights into mountaineering history and Himalayan culture.
name: Pokhara

detail_description: Nestled within the breathtaking landscape of Pokhara, the Seti River Gorge is a stunning natural wonder that showcases the power and beauty of glacial waters. This remarkable gorge, carved by the rushing Seti River as it flows through a narrow ravine, offers visitors an incredible view of its milky white waters. The river originates from nearby Himalayan glaciers and plays a vital role in both local culture and hydroelectric power generation.
name: Seti River Gorge

excerpt: Small, rustic museum dedicated to documenting the history & culture of the region's ethnic groups.
detail_description: The Pokhara Regional Museum offers a captivating journey through the history and culture of the region's ethnic groups. Located just 2 km from the city center, this rustic museum showcases ancient artifacts, handicrafts, and exhibits that provide insights into Pokhara's rich heritage. From Stone Age relics to depictions of tribal lifestyles and traditions, the museum offers a tangible experience of the city's past.
name: Regional Museum

detail_description: Shree Gaden Dhargay Ling Monastery, located in Pokhara, Nepal, is a Tibetan Buddhist monastery aimed at promoting awareness of Buddhist and Tibetan culture. It is a popular tourist destination offering a serene and peaceful environment for visitors to find inner peace away from urban life. Inhabited by 28 monks, this quaint institution is situated inside the Tashiling refugee camp and has historical significance with other temples nearby.
name: Shree Gaden Dhargay Ling Monastery

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Pokhara, the Annapurna Museum, also known as the Natural History Museum, is a treasure trove for nature enthusiasts and culture seekers alike. Operated by the Annapurna Conservation Area Project (ACAP), this museum showcases an impressive array of butterflies, insects, birds, and wildlife models that highlight the region's rich biodiversity. Located conveniently at Prithvi Narayan Campus near the old bazaar, it offers visitors a fascinating glimpse into both local flora and fauna.
name: Annapurna Museum

excerpt: A well-known tourist spot, this scenic waterfall travels through caves & underground tunnels.
detail_description: Devi's Fall in Pokhara is a captivating tourist spot known for its scenic waterfall that travels through caves and underground tunnels. The Pardi Khola watercourse mysteriously disappears underground before reemerging as the magnificent Devi's Fall. This natural wonder is particularly stunning during the monsoon season, from June to August. The backdrop of the Annapurna range and the prominent Mt. Fishtail add to the allure of this location.
name: Devi’s Fall Pokhara

excerpt: Guided tours of a cave accessible by steps, with thousands of bats hanging from the ceiling.
detail_description: Chamero Cave, also known as Bat Cave, is a fascinating underground attraction in Pokhara. Accessible by steps, this limestone cave is home to thousands of Horseshoe Bats hanging from the ceiling. The dark and moist chambers create a friendly environment for these small bats. Visitors can marvel at the beautiful limestone patterns on the walls and roof while being mindful not to disturb the inhabitants with unnecessary lights or noise. Exploring this cave offers an adventurous experience that nature enthusiasts will appreciate.
name: Bat Cave (Chamero Gufa)

detail_description: In Pokhara, amidst the thrill of adventure sports and mountain hikes, there are serene temples waiting to be explored. The Bhimsen Temple is a notable stop, dedicated to the deity of business and trade, located near the Krishna temple in Patan. This historical site offers visitors a glimpse into Hindu culture and mythology. Additionally, Pokhara boasts other famous temples like Gupteshwar Gufa, Kedareshwar Mahadev, and Mani Temple.
name: Bhimsen Temple

excerpt: Boating & fishing are popular activities at this serene, scenic park with a sizable lake.
detail_description: Basundhara Park, located in Pokhara, is a serene and scenic getaway popular among locals. The park offers a tranquil environment for visitors to enjoy activities such as boating and fishing on its sizable lake. Additionally, the park features a rock art garden and opportunities to rent boats or play volleyball. Despite being underrated among tourists, it is rich in nature and serves as a shelter for various bird species.
name: Basundhara Park

detail_description: Sarangkot View Point is a must-visit destination in Pokhara, Nepal. Situated at an elevation of 1600 meters, it offers breathtaking panoramic views of the Annapurna range, Dhaulagiri range, Manaslu, and the picturesque Pokhara city. This popular spot is renowned for its stunning sunrise and sunset vistas over the Himalayas.
name: Sarangkot View Point

detail_description: Annapurna is a renowned destination for travelers and trekkers, with Pokhara serving as the gateway to this spectacular region. In addition to the popular treks in Annapurna, there are numerous shorter trekking options around Pokhara that offer breathtaking views of the majestic Annapurna mountains. These short treks vary in duration, ranging from day hikes to weeklong adventures, providing visitors with diverse opportunities to experience the beauty of the Annapurna massifs.
name: Annapurna

excerpt: Dhampus is a village and Village Development Committee in Kaski District in the Gandaki Zone of northern-central Nepal. The village is located 19 km away from the Pokhara Baglung Highways and falls within the trekking route of Mardi Himal Trek. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Dhampus, located in the Kaski District of Nepal, is a charming village that has been gaining popularity as a tourist destination. With a population of around 2,753 people living in individual households, this picturesque village offers visitors an opportunity to experience authentic Nepali lifestyle away from urban areas. A short trek to Dhampus is recommended for those seeking a day-long adventure and an immersive cultural experience.
name: Dhampus

detail_description: Lake Side Boating in Pokhara is a must-do activity that offers stunning views of the Himalayas, including Macchapuchre and Annapurna. The serene environment, gentle breeze, and the Tal Barahi temple at the center of Phewa Lake make it an unforgettable experience. Additionally, visitors can explore Begnas and Rupa Lakes for a more tranquil boating experience surrounded by lush hills.
name: Lake Side Boating

detail_description: Located on the lakeside of Pokhara, Pokhara Disneyland offers a variety of fun activities for visitors. From a Ferris wheel to skating and driving vehicles, the park is filled with laughter and joy during the day. At night, the entire area comes alive with bright and colorful lights. The amusement park is suitable for both adults and children, featuring games like electric cars, billiard tables, small boats, inflatable games, and more.
name: Pokhara Disneyland

detail_description: Jangchub Choeling Monastery, founded by the 14th Dalai Lama in 1967 and overseen by Lama Dupsing Rinpoche, is a renowned historic site in Pokhara. Initially home to 35 monks, it now accommodates hundreds and houses numerous Kagyu and Tengyur scriptures. This educational institution offers teachings on philosophy, poetry, grammar, and more.
name: Jangchub Choeling Monastery

excerpt: Scenic destination with rowboats, lakefront restaurants & views of the Annapurna Himalaya Range.
detail_description: Pokhara Lakeside is a picturesque destination offering rowboats, lakefront restaurants, and breathtaking views of the Annapurna Himalaya Range. Located on Street #15, Central Lakeside in Pokhara, it boasts over 200 souvenir shops, restaurants, bars, taverns, and clubs.
name: Pokhara Lakeside

detail_description: Paddle Nepal is a rafting outfitter in Nepal that offers beginner and intermediate level whitewater rafting trips. The company runs three-day trips down the Seti River and one day on Pokhara Lake, as well as longer expeditions down the lower Seti. The company employs qualified guides who provide safety and support during the trip. The scenery along the river is beautiful, with rapids that are both challenging and fun.
name: Paddle Nepal
address: Lakeside Center Mall Baidam Road, Pokhara 33700, Nepal

detail_description: BIG SPLASH Waterpark is a relatively new and well-maintained water wonderland that offers an enjoyable experience for both kids and adults. It's highly recommended for families and individuals of all ages, providing a variety of thrilling attractions in a family-friendly atmosphere. The staff are dedicated and friendly, ensuring visitors have a great time. With clean facilities and separate swimming pools, it's a fantastic place to spend quality time with family while relieving stress through the waves of water.
name: Big Splash Waterpark

detail_description: Bungee Pokhara offers Nepal's first and only tower bungee experience, just a short 25-minute drive from Pokhara Lakeside. This thrilling adventure includes a 70-meter vertical drop with 3 seconds of free fall, providing breathtaking views of the Himalayas, hills, and rivers. With safety as a top priority, highly trained jump masters and advanced technology ensure a secure experience.
name: Bungee Pokhara

detail_description: Caffe Concerto in Pokhara, Nepal is a versatile spot that serves as both a pizzeria and a lively bar. During the day, it's known for its delicious pizzas, pastas, and salads, attracting food enthusiasts. At night, it transforms into a vibrant bar with jazz music where patrons can enjoy drinks by the fireplace. The venue also appeals to those looking for a cozy coffee spot to chat or read newspapers.
name: Caffe Concerto

detail_description: Sadhana Yoga Retreat Centre is a serene haven located just outside Pokhara, offering breathtaking views of the lake and providing a peaceful environment for spiritual seekers. The center provides an immersive experience in yoga, meditation, and reflexology, allowing guests to connect with themselves while being cared for by the warm and welcoming Sadhana family. Visitors can enjoy delicious and healthy meals during their stay and partake in activities such as silent retreats.
name: Sadhana Yoga Retreat Centre

excerpt: Simple dorms & rooms, plus a restaurant, in a low-key hostel offering Wi-Fi & breakfast.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Pokhara, Pokhara Backpackers Hostel is a vibrant and low-key accommodation option for travelers seeking a lively atmosphere and cost-effective stay. The hostel offers simple dorms and rooms, along with a restaurant serving breakfast. Its common area hosts themed parties and live music nights, creating an ideal setting for making international friendships. Additionally, the hostel provides facilities such as free parking, allergy-friendly rooms, and even a nightclub.
name: Pokhara Backpackers Hostel

detail_description: Kiwi Backpackers Hostel, located near Fewa Lake and the market, offers a comfortable stay with basic amenities. The hostel has a lively vibe, attracting backpackers from around the world and providing opportunities to make new friends. The rooftop restaurant and bar are great for socializing. Guests appreciate the helpful staff, including owner Suman and manager Maya, who offer guidance on activities like the Annapurna Circuit trek.
name: Kiwi Backpackers Hostel
address: 7 kiwi Ln, 5th Street Ammat, Lakeside Rd, Pokhara 33700, Nepal

detail_description: Mantra Yoga School in Pokhara, Nepal is a popular destination for spiritual seekers and yoga enthusiasts. The school offers a variety of yoga classes, from vinyasa to meditation, set against the backdrop of the magnificent landscape of Pokhara. Students have praised the quality of teaching and the holistic approach to learning, which goes beyond just yoga asanas and meditation to encompass life philosophy and self-care.
name: Yoga Teacher Training Nepal - 200 Hour 300 Hour Mantra Yoga School Pokhara
address: C/o New Solitary Lodge, Lakeside Rd 6, Pokhara 33700, Nepal

detail_description: Movie Garden provides a unique and refreshing nightlife experience, offering the opportunity to watch movies in an open-air amphitheater under the stars. This setting is a departure from the typical nightlife scene, allowing guests to enjoy a relaxing evening while watching their favorite films. In addition to the movie screenings starting at 7 pm each evening, Movie Garden also offers a variety of food and drink options, including pizzas, popcorn, cocktails, and alcoholic beverages that can be enjoyed right at your seat.
name: Movie Garden

detail_description: Lake Valley Paragliding Pvt Ltd offers an unforgettable paragliding experience in Pokhara Valley. With experienced pilots and top-notch customer service, they ensure a safe and enjoyable adventure for guests. The company also provides high-quality videos and pictures to capture the breathtaking 1300m above ground experience. It's a must-try activity in Nepal, offering a liberating feeling of flying like a bird while taking in the stunning landscapes of this beautiful country.
name: Lake Valley Paragliding pvt ltd

detail_description: Bèllè Lyìpá is a popular spot that's been making waves on Instagram, and for good reason. While the almond croissant was unfortunately out of stock during my visit, I did get to try the blueberry and pain au chocolat. The pain au chocolat was a standout with its buttery, soft texture and perfectly balanced melting chocolate center. On the other hand, the blueberry pastry was a bit too sweet for my liking due to its generous cream filling.
name: Bèllè Lyìpá

detail_description: Sarangkot Paragliding Pvt. Ltd. provides adventure sports such as paragliding in Sarangkot, a mountainous region in the state of Himachal Pradesh, India.
name: Sarangkot Paragliding Pvt. Ltd

detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque Pokhara valley, Himalayan Golf Course offers a unique golfing experience with its stunning views of the Himalayan mountains. Despite being relatively unknown and neglected, this course provides a challenging game as players often tee off from cliffs onto small fairways. The presence of a ball boy is helpful for locating balls and aiming shots. With its remote location away from the city, the clean environment and panoramic vistas make it an exceptional place to play golf.
name: Himalayan Golf Course

excerpt: Hiking destination & base camp with grand views of the famous Annapurna mountain of the Himalayas.
detail_description: The Annapurna Base Camp Trek is a remarkable journey through the heart of the Annapurna Himalayas, offering stunning views of snow-capped peaks, verdant forests, and picturesque villages. The trail is moderately challenging and suitable for various trekkers. It provides a cultural experience with encounters with local Gurung and Magar communities. The teahouse accommodations along the route offer comfort and convenience.
name: Annapurna Base Camp Trekking

detail_description: Pandeli Park is a delightful green oasis that invites visitors to unwind and connect with nature. Nestled in a vibrant area, this park features lush landscapes, walking paths, and serene spots perfect for picnics or leisurely strolls. Families can enjoy the playground facilities while fitness enthusiasts appreciate the jogging trails.
name: Pandeli Park

detail_description: Pumdikot Religious Area, nestled in Kathmandu, Nepal, is a hidden gem that offers a unique experience for travelers seeking an escape from the city. The village provides serene retreat with panoramic views of the surrounding mountains and the majestic Himalayas. It's also home to a recently built statue of Lord Shiva which has become a popular destination in Pokhara. Despite being under construction, Pumdikot promises to be an amazing spot with better amenities and hangout spots soon.
name: Pumdikot Religious Area

detail_description: Located in Pumdikot, Nepal, the Pumdikot Shiva Statue is a remarkable sight to behold. Standing at around 51 feet tall, it is one of the largest statues in the country. Despite undergoing renovations, its impressive size and intricate design still captivate visitors. The statue offers stunning panoramic views of Pokhara and Phewa Lake as well as the Himalayan mountain range.
name: (Hotel)Pumdikot Shiva Statue

detail_description: The Great Machhapuchhre Trail (GMT) is a popular hiking route located near Pokhara, offering breathtaking panoramic views. This trail is renowned for its stunning natural beauty and is a must-visit for outdoor enthusiasts. It provides an excellent opportunity to immerse oneself in the picturesque landscapes and experience the tranquility of the surrounding environment.
name: Great Machhapuchhre Trail (GMT)
